is a small mountain village in the
region. The village is perched on the side of the mountain 'Colle Rotondo' and has a picturesque medieval centre.
Bugnara has a tiny railway station, about ten minutes walk away in the valley. About five trains run daily from Sulmona from 6AM until 8PM (the last one runs through
There are actually about three or fours buses a day from
Tiburtina bus station that stop in Bugnara on their way to Scanno. The bus stops by the bridge at the bottom of the town. There are about seven local buses a day that run from
and Torre Del Nolfi that stop in the main square.

On the A25 take the exit for Anversa (if you are coming from Rome) or Sulmona if you are coming from Pescara. Bugnara is about ten minutes drive away from each exit (follow signs to Introdacqua and Bugnara).
Bugnara is small enough to cover entirely on foot.

value: content=Imposing on the main square and ringing its bells every hour this church dates from 1602. Built in the late baroque style beautiful friezes, stuccoes and relief ceilings.
content=Bugnara is steep and full of narrow pedestrian streets. Here you can see Bugnara's medieval origins with an incredible patchwork layering of stone and cement.

content=This enormous palace consists of imposing buildings started around the 11th Century. The impressive fortifications surround a courtyard where one can see the various stages of its development, including an impressive clock tower. Restoration of the palace is in the works, with a rumoured cooking school to be housed there.
name=Church of the Madonna delle Neve

content=Just outside the village this church has some of the most interesting history of Bugnara. Built in the Gothic style around the 11th Century it has an extraordinary herring-bone floor that is actually from the Roman temple upon which the church was built. It also has some very well preserved statues and frescoes,
content=At the end of June there is Pecorino tasting and music.
content=Being a small town, there is always activity and people in the main square.
content=There are markets for various goods in the main square.

content=Although the village has two well stocked Alimentari (grocery shops) the best thing to do is to find out the times of the meat, vegetable and fish trucks that make their way around the small villages.
The castle complex of Palazzo Ducale
content=The village has a post office, hairdressers and a pharmacy.
directions=Up a few steps from the bar in the main square

content=This beautiful little restaurant used to be open in the summer (in 2007) where you could sit in the middle of the ancient ruins and have some lovely local home-cooked food. The sign is still there but I'm not sure that it is still open.
Have a coffee or a beer at the bar on the Piazza.

Plenty of B&Bs and private houses for rent.

value: content=A two bedroom house in the centre of Bugnara.
takes about 10 minutes by car, 40 minutes on a bike or a couple of hours to walk (the walk is pretty nice through the fields in the valley)
At the top of the village are the beginnings of many beautiful hiking trails up into the hills.
